title: Livestock and livelihoods webinar series: Crossroads of animal human and environment health

tasks.task: Attend and Participate in a Webinar on One Health
subtasks: Greet participants and introduce yourself
Share information about the webinar series and previous session
Request participants to share full names and organizations
Enable closed captioning and provide troubleshooting advice for technical issues
Encourage using the chat for questions and provide guidance on interacting during the webinar

tasks.task: Discuss the Impact of Land Use Policies on One Health
subtasks: Explain how privatization of land can lead to increased disease spillover
Highlight the importance of integrated management of landscapes for sustainable coexistence of agriculture and wildlife
Emphasize the need for collaboration among ecologists, veterinarians, public health professionals, and policymakers

tasks.task: Present Challenges and Opportunities in Livestock Research for One Health
subtasks: Address the global challenge of feeding the growing population while managing zoonotic diseases
Discuss the disparity in meat consumption between high-income and low- and middle-income countries
Highlight the environmental impacts of increased livestock production, such as antimicrobial resistance and methane emissions
Explore the interplay between land degradation, environmental pollution, and increased risk of disease spillover

tasks.task: Explain the Role of Data and Local Capacity Building in One Health Initiatives
subtasks: Address the lack of data and surveillance systems in low-income regions
Stress the importance of utilizing local knowledge and resources for sustainable interventions
Provide examples of successful data collection and capacity building in One Health (e.g., Rift Valley fever studies)

tasks.task: Discuss Barriers and Opportunities in Scaling Up One Health Practices
subtasks: Outline challenges in vertical (institutional) and horizontal (expansion of practices) scaling of One Health initiatives
Highlight the importance of policy makers, partnerships, and research-informed decision-making in scaling Up One Health
Mention the use of tools like the Network for Evaluation of One Health to improve platform performance

tasks.task: Present Examples of One Health Implementation in Practice
subtasks: Review the USDA-funded Skill project in Georgia, focusing on market systems development and food safety education
Explain the use of animated videos and education materials in livestock sector capacity building
Describe the ILRI Hill program's work on participatory range land management and One Health service delivery in pastoralist communities

tasks.task: Address Key Questions and Challenges in One Health
subtasks: Discuss the integration of environmental health into One Health initiatives
Analyze the different interests of stakeholders (donors, local governments, livestock owners) and identify win-win solutions
Evaluate the challenges of engaging farmers and promoting behavioral change in One Health practices

tasks.task: Emphasize the Importance of Consumer Demand and Market Pressure in Driving Healthy Livestock Practices
subtasks: Highlight the need for strong consumer demand for healthy and sustainable food products
Encourage collaboration between researchers, policymakers, and the private sector to address One Health challenges

tasks.task: Recap Key Lessons and Call to Action
subtasks: Summarize the main points discussed during the webinar
Thank participants for their engagement and share information about future webinars and resources for more reading on One Health.
